body.name: GreenLife Soft Grip Healthy Ceramic Nonstick 12" Frying Pan Skillet, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Turquoise
features: Our healthy and easy-to-clean ceramic nonstick coating is derived from sand and free of PFAS, PFOA, lead, and cadmium for effortless cooking and quick cleanup
Soft Grip's Bakelite handle is designed to stay cool on the stovetop for maximum comfort
Made from recycled aluminum and reinforced with a wobble-free base for extra strength and even heating
Dishwasher safe, but most messes wipe away
Rivetless interior to prevent snags and food buildup
body.description: This Soft Grip frying pan is all about comfort and control. Designed for effortless performance and cleanup, this pan features our toxin-free Thermolon nonstick coating, which is free of PFAS, PFOA, lead, and cadmium. GreenLife’s healthy ceramic nonstick is not stuck in the past—that’s why our ceramic nonstick starts with sand and creates 60% less CO2 emissions during the curing phase than traditional coatings. This pan is also crafted with recycled aluminum, because we want your kids to cook healthy, too. Finished in vibrant colors, this pan is outfitted with a stay-cool handle to keep your cooking comfortable. For all stovetops, except induction. Oven safe to 350°F. Dishwasher safe.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: GreenLife Soft Grip Non-Toxic Ceramic Nonstick Cookware

Cook in Color! GreenLife Soft Grip Soft Grip is all about comfort, control, and color. Featuring a stay-cool handle, the vibrant Soft Grip collection is designed to make easy cooking even easier. Our ceramic nonstick is not stuck in the past. Our coating starts with sand to give you effortless nonstick performance without the chemicals. Free of PFAS, PFOA, lead, and cadmium. The pans themselves are made of recycled aluminum, so your kid's kids can cook easy. Easy to Clean! Healthy Ceramic Nonstick GreenLife's healthy ceramic nonstick coating is free of PFAS, PFOA, lead, and cadmium. What's that mean for you? No toxic fumes, even if it's overheated. The same great performance as traditional nonstick, just without the nasties. Our Most Comfortable Handle! Stay-Cool Comfort Grip Soft Grip's Bakelite handles make for cozy and comfortable cooking. Get More from Your Pans! Oven Safe Up to 350°F Take your cooking from the stovetop to the oven with Soft Grip's ready-for-anything design. Big Messes Don't Stand a Chance! Dishwasher Safe Soft Grip has a rivetless interior to make cleanup simple. When things get really messy, though, it's easy to toss it in the dishwasher. Make Everything a Little Greener! Recycled Aluminum Bodies These pots and pans are made from recycled aluminum and reinforced with wobble-free bases for extra strength and even heating. Designed to perform perfectly on gas and electric stovetops.
Watch Our GreenLife Soft Grip Collection in Action!

Previous page Tough & Vibrant Crafted from recycled aluminum, this quick-heating construction offers instant results. Ceramic Nonstick Our healthy ceramic nonstick is derived from sand and free of PFAS, PFOA, lead, and cadmium. Comfortable Grip Soft Grip features stay-cool handles to keep your cooking comfortable. Forged Base Thick, durable forged bases prevent these pans from warping and wobbling over time. Glass Lid Want to keep an eye on your food without losing heat? These durable glass lids make it easy. Next page Pots and Pans Made to Last 1 Body 2 Coating 3 Handle 4 Base 5 Lid

For you and everyone else Our ceramic nonstick is not stuck in the past! Reduce your carbon cookprint Our coating’s curing phase creates 60% less CO2 than the curing phase for traditional coatings. Buy recycled, reduce waste Because the second time around is better. Toxin-free and extra clean Our ceramic nonstick is a twist on nonstick. Free of PFAS (& all the other nasties).
Get the Most Out of Your Pan

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One pan meal
reviews.reviewText: Great size for cooking an entire meal for two. Cleaning is a breeze. Recommended

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a great pan. You can cook eggs with minimal oil, just a drop. I've even cooked perfect eggs without. Let the pan heat up, let the drop of oil heat up, then cook perfect eggs.The only drawback is that it does not work with induction stovetops.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great nonstick ceramic -- if you follow the rules.
reviews.reviewText: Great nonstick ceramic skillet! Like everyone else commenting here, I have had many experiences with ruining nonstick skillets. This is my second skillet of this brand/type, and the first one is holding up well because I am finally following the following rules: Never heat beyond low or medium. Heat empty for one minute – – no more. Never use oil spray! The propellant creates a sticky problem over time. After one minute of heating, add a very small amount of butter or oil. Heat 30 seconds, then add your food. Never, ever use any utensils with this skillet except for plastic or silicone! Forget the dishwasher. Only AFTER the skillet is cool, gently wash it with a sponge and soap. Dry it gently and do not stack it with other hard items unless you put a dish towel between them. This sounds like a lot of trouble, but it's a lot more trouble to throw out your nonstick skillet every few months when it loses its nonstick qualities. One other piece of advice: order one of these exclusively for cooking omelettes or other eggs. Never cook anything else in it. A good French omelette requires a wonderfully nonstick surface.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall a great item, just have a care.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The pan had a scratch on the exterior right out of the box. Hopefully that will not cause any issues down the road with the rest of the finish. We have only used it once so far to cook some eggs and pancakes. My husband had not read the instructions and wasn’t careful to keep the flame on the gas stove directly under the pan and the base of the handle began to get toasted and smelled bad. So just be warned if you have a gas stove especially don’t let the flame reach beyond the bottom surface of the pan. It’s sad the handle is now slightly brown there after our first use. Other than that the pan looks great in the kitchen, and the pancakes and eggs cooked up perfectly and the pan was easy to wash.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent choice for moderate priced ceramic pan
reviews.reviewText: I have wanted to make the switch to ceramic pans and bake ware for some time. When my old frying pan's Teflon coating (something I want to get away from) started flaking, I decided to try this pan. After using it, I decided to replace my current set with a full line of GreenLife's pots and pans (I will buy bake wear in the future). The pan is lightweight and I love the soft grip handles, they are cool to the touch and very secure. There has been no sticking at all and clean up is an absolute breeze. I am careful to follow usage and washing instructions and I just loved it. Looking forward to my complete set arriving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Pleasantly Surprised!!!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this pan for my husband, so he did not ruin my new set of pans. I bought this because of two things: the price, and its not Teflon. I was looking at this set when I bough my new set and decided against it. But, boy am I really surprised. This one is one of the cheaper models that this company offers and I have to say....This pan is really nice. These sorts of pans need a little oil or butter in them to perform well, and this one does! I use low heat on all of my non Teflon pans and this is no exception. Lightweight without feeling cheap, nice handle and good heat distribution. The only downside is no metal conductor on the bottom of the pan. But after using for about a month on gas stove, it is holding up nicely with hardly any evidence of use. I use only silicone utensils on the pan and so far no problems. My husband is really hard on cookware and this is holding up to his high heat fast cooking style. I will be looking at this company's options if I am ever in need of new set. Would be nice if these companies would offer separate lids for an option. Really like the lids with the silicone rim. Just saying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Didn’t last long
reviews.reviewText: I liked this pan initially, but after a few months food would stick even though I followed care instructions as written. I was disappointed.

Aunque la acabo de comprar y la he utilizado 3 veces, por ahora estoy muy contenta.No es barata, pero todo por la salud!!Antes de usarla la cure con un lavado suave con agua tibia y jabón extra suave y neutro, con un poquito de aceite al fuego, la deje enfriar, retire el aceite con una servilleta dejando un pelín de aceite en la misma.La trato con mucho mimo para que me dure el máximo posible.De hecho al ser tan grande y gustarme bastante he adquirido también las otras 2 que vienen en pack de la misma marca.Son muy bonitas, la grande en turquesa y el pack en rosa.
It’s a pleasure to cook with. Large, easy to clean. It’s the second one bought, the previous one was smaller. It’s are great to use. Easy to recommend.
Para hacer tortilla....no se pega nada absolutamente...genial

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price this is a good option
reviews.reviewText: It's not as nonstick as I would have liked, so I returned and bought GreenPan instead (but for a higher price).
